meanings.definition: A group of unruly or rowdy individuals.
meanings.sent1: The randies at the party were causing a lot of noise.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bunch of randies running around the park.
meanings.sent3: The randies decided to have a dance-off in the middle of the street.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was full of randies, each trying to outdo the other.
meanings.sent5: The randies were like a pack of wild animals, loud and untamed.

meanings.definition: A collection of random or miscellaneous items.
meanings.sent1: She kept all her randies in a small box on her desk.
meanings.sent2: The garage sale had a table full of interesting randies.
meanings.sent3: His backpack was filled with all sorts of randies, from pens to snacks.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest was full of glittering randies, each more precious than the last.
meanings.sent5: The attic was a treasure trove of forgotten randies, waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: To behave in a wild or disorderly manner.
meanings.sent1: The children began to randies around the playground, laughing and shouting.
meanings.sent2: After the game, the players started to randies in celebration.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys in the zoo seemed to randies whenever visitors passed by.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside made the trees randies in the wind, their branches thrashing wildly.
meanings.sent5: The music was so infectious that it made everyone want to randies on the dance floor.
